answers.answer: If you don't eat when you should you will get it too..that's my experience at least..aww the joys of pregnancy..this is my third baby and I will tell u that darn heartburn will never fully go away

Oh my, I feel you. Heartburns are real *****. Its so uncomfortable. I have terrible ones since middle of 2nd trimester. Now I am on my 30th week. Im due Feb 8th. I discovered by accident drinking cold milk for me helps alot. Nothing else helped. Try it. Best of luck!
I don't want to scare, or jump the gun, but heartburn that doesn't get better with tums or anything like that, is a sign of preeclampsia.

I have had horrible heartburn since my second trimester. I'm 36 weeks now. Every night no matter what I do it never fails. Zantac and milk are life savers! Also, I've never heard of heartburn being linked to preeclampsia.

Had heartburn with each pregnancy,even water gave me heartburn, didn't go away after my 3rd, preggo with my 4th now...it's awful stuff to deal with. I always keep tums and Zantac close by!! Good luck!

I had it with my first and now my second too. Although it a not as bad yet. I even had it when I was in labor from eating the ice chips but for me it went away soon as the baby was out and I ate a whole arbys combo with no issue(I don't recommend doing that).

Omg yes heartburn is a killer !!! I feel your pain girl!! I take Tums and zantac on a regular basis!!! Sometimes it's so bad that the zantac doesn't even do it! It's kinda one of them pregnant things haha, good luck to ya!
Since we're in this heartburn kick, did any of your babies have Alot of hair? This question is for previous mom's who have had heartburn with previous pregnancies ??

My dr gave me a list of symptoms to look out for. It's heartburn that DOESN'T go away after taking tums or antacids, or anything like that. Also, right sided rib pain, and headache that doesn't go away.
Because everything is more compacted from baby it's easier for your stomach acid to work it's way up...even if you haven't eaten anything. It's just a part of pregnancy.

Sadly it's just a side effect of pregnancy. My dr had to prescribe a medication for me bc over the counter stuff didnt work. Ask your dr. I used nexium and oh the sweet relief lol.   :) and my daughter had a ton of hair. Im prefnant
Oops anyway, im pregnant with our son now and get terrible heartburn again with this pregnancy. :/
I also have awful heartburn. Tums help sometimes.Once baby drops out gets much better, though. I was taking tums daily but now only every few days. Yay.

question: I don't understand how I can get heartburn when I haven't even ate anything yet! This happens to me a lot. Does it happen to any of you guys too? Thank god for tums though. Due February 2nd and can't wait to have my baby girl :)
title: Heartburn!
